Change the ejbjar to separate out vendor specific processing into separate tool classes.Split the Descriptor handler to a separate classnnAllow local DTDs to be loaded to resolve the external entitiesnnMoved all Weblogic specific code into a separate deployment tool object.nnUsage for generic jars is nownn<ejbjar srcdir=${descriptor.dir} destdir=${deploymentjar.dir}>n  <include name=**/*-ejb-jar.xml/>n</ejbjar>nnnFor a weblogic deployment you now add a nested element with the weblogic specificnconfigsnn<ejbjar srcdir=${descriptor.dir}>n  <weblogic destdir=${deploymentjar.dir}nclasspath=${descriptorbuild.classpath}nkeepgeneric=falsensuffix=.jar/>n  <include name=**/*-ejb-jar.xml/>n  <exclude name=**/*-weblogic-ejb-jar.xml/>n</ejbjar>nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@267868 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Always handle refid first. Refid normally cannot be used with other attributes and some types check for this. The code is broken in a number of places - if refid is not set first. Since nobody objects, this is the project helper modularization commit.The default is ProjectHelperImpl, which have the original ( SAX1 ) implementation.nnMost of the XML-related code has been removed, the only remaining problemnis the AttributeList that is passed to the introspection helper ( which isnXML and SAX1 specific ). Rewritten the introspection part of ProjectHelper.1. Moved all introspection activities to a helper class.n2. setter methods can now use parameters of a far richer set ofn   types. See the modified patch task as an example.n3. Nested Elements can be created by the task with createElement() orn   by IntrospectionHelper if the task implements void addElement(ObjectType).n4. Documented addText(String) and nested elements in the Writing Yourn   own Task section and changed the documentation for the setter methods.n5. Added getLocation method to BuildException.n6. Changed the return type of Ant.createProperty from Task to Propertyn   - as this is what gets returned anyway.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@267753 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Started refactoring.Made BuildException extend TaskException. Now BuildException is no longer a RuntimException and needs to be declared everywhere it could be thrownnnRemoved the constructors that took location info for BuildException. Location is something known about byt the container and the tasks them selves should not be worrying about that sort of thingnnRemoved a bunch of deprecated methods and features. Also moved all file handling utilities outside iof the Project class. To aid the transition I added a resolveFile method to the base ProjectComponent class.nn480 odd compile errors left to clean up.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@270158 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Move the execute related classes into a new package.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@270241 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

* Rolled back change to PropertyResolver.resolveProperties(), so that it   uses a TaskContext again.  Added some regression tests.* Changed Embeddor.createWorkspace() to use a Map, rather than a Parameters,n  to supply initial workspace properties.  Initial properties can be Objects,n  rather than only Strings.  Got rid of the Object -> String convertion fromn  <ant> and <antcall>.nn* Generalised ExecutionFrame, so that it can represent any execution scopen  (root, workspace, project, task, inherited, etc), rather than just task scope:n  - Replaced getTaskContext() with getPropertyStore().n  - Replaced getTypeManager() with getServiceManager().nn* Executor is now responsible for creating TaskContext.nn* Changed DefaultExecutor to use the configurer provided by the execution frame.nn* Added ExecutionContainer, a lifecycle interface which is used to supply then  root execution frame to a service which executes tasks (directly or indirectly).nn* Changed interaction between DefaultEmbeddor and workspaces.  Embeddor is nown  responsible for creating the base property store for workspaces.  ExecutionContainern  is used to pass this to workspaces.  Parameterizable is now used to passn  container params to workspaces (which matches how it is used with all then  other services).nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@272302 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Changed embeddor so that a new ProjectBuilder is instantiated on every call to createProject. There is no longer a globally Cached and configured ProjectManager.Also retrieved the ProjectBuilder from TypeManager. This allows arbitrarynProjectBuilder classes to be registered by dropping in new jars to lib directory.nnMade the type of ProjectBuilder be specified by type parameter or if that isnnull the extention of input build file.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@269189 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Rewritten the introspection part of ProjectHelper.1. Moved all introspection activities to a helper class.n2. setter methods can now use parameters of a far richer set ofn   types. See the modified patch task as an example.n3. Nested Elements can be created by the task with createElement() orn   by IntrospectionHelper if the task implements void addElement(ObjectType).n4. Documented addText(String) and nested elements in the Writing Yourn   own Task section and changed the documentation for the setter methods.n5. Added getLocation method to BuildException.n6. Changed the return type of Ant.createProperty from Task to Propertyn   - as this is what gets returned anyway.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@267753 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

* Rolled back change to PropertyResolver.resolveProperties(), so that it   uses a TaskContext again.  Added some regression tests.* Changed Embeddor.createWorkspace() to use a Map, rather than a Parameters,n  to supply initial workspace properties.  Initial properties can be Objects,n  rather than only Strings.  Got rid of the Object -> String convertion fromn  <ant> and <antcall>.nn* Generalised ExecutionFrame, so that it can represent any execution scopen  (root, workspace, project, task, inherited, etc), rather than just task scope:n  - Replaced getTaskContext() with getPropertyStore().n  - Replaced getTypeManager() with getServiceManager().nn* Executor is now responsible for creating TaskContext.nn* Changed DefaultExecutor to use the configurer provided by the execution frame.nn* Added ExecutionContainer, a lifecycle interface which is used to supply then  root execution frame to a service which executes tasks (directly or indirectly).nn* Changed interaction between DefaultEmbeddor and workspaces.  Embeddor is nown  responsible for creating the base property store for workspaces.  ExecutionContainern  is used to pass this to workspaces.  Parameterizable is now used to passn  container params to workspaces (which matches how it is used with all then  other services).nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@272302 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Rewritten the introspection part of ProjectHelper.1. Moved all introspection activities to a helper class.n2. setter methods can now use parameters of a far richer set ofn   types. See the modified patch task as an example.n3. Nested Elements can be created by the task with createElement() orn   by IntrospectionHelper if the task implements void addElement(ObjectType).n4. VFS Additions:* Added FileSelector, which allows files to be chosen when doing recursiven  operations.  Added a couple of implementations.  Added a selector parametern  to FileObject.delete() and copy().nn* Added FileObject.replicateFile(), which converts a FileObject into a local File.nn* Moved replication code out of the Zip provider, into a shared FileReplicatorn  component.  The implemenation is pretty brain-dead, but at very least shouldn  properly clean up temporary files in ant_vfs_cache.  Also, local files willn  no longer be replicated, but used directly.nn* Added FileName.getRelativeName(), and NameScope.DESCENDENT_OR_SELF.nn* Now handles providers which are LogEnabled and Disposable.nn* Made the local file provider pluggable.nn* Providers are now responsible for thier own caching.nn* FTP and Zip providers clean up properly.  Fixed FTP directory delete.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@272262 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Changes to DefaultDeployer:* Got rid of <converters> element from antlib descriptor.  Converters aren  now defined in the <types> element.nn* Moved (most of) the role-specific knowledge from Deployment back to DefaultDeployer.nn* Split out ClassLoader management into DefaultClassLoaderManager.  This isn  living in the deployer package for now.nn* Tidied-up the component set-up and clean-up in DefaultEmbeddor.  Addedn  the ClassLoaderManager component.nn* Added test for TypeDeployer.deployAll().nnChanges to unit tests:nn* Added AbstractMyrmidonTest, which takes care of locating test resources.nn* Changed the VFS, type factory, and deployer tests to use AbstractMyrmidonTest.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271271 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

VFS Tidy-ups:* Added FileObject.copy().nn* Renamed <v-copy> task attributes file -> srcfile, tofile -> destfile, todir -> destdir.nn* Moved provider instantiation out of DefaultFileSystemManager, and inton  myrmidon-aware VfsManager.  Providers are instantiated using the TypeManager.n  The list of providers isnt configurable yet.nn* Some support for %nn encoded URI (not quite complete).nn* Zip file system now handles zip files from any file system, not just localn  files.  Still read-only at this stage.  Uses a truely dodgy and very temporaryn  replication mechanism.nn* Zip file system now handles relative paths in URI (e.g. zip:relpath.zip), that aren  resolved against the base dir.nn* Fixed bug in resolving names against the root file of a file system.nn* Changed behaviour of FileName.resolveName( .. ) for the root file ofn  a file system.nn* Added more test cases.nn* A bucketload of other minor changes.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271803 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

A small refactoring, getting to a more real interface for the dynamic properties.This is not final, of course.nnPropertyHelper will implement all property manipulation. Eventually innant1.6 the static methods in various places should just wrap andncall this. In 1.6 the property storage can also be migrated to thisnclass.nnIt should be possible by a task or embedding application to replacenthe whole mechanism - no need for discovery on this one, it can bendone by a task.nnThe PropertyInterceptor will be used to plug different sourcesnfor the property. Im thinking to just have tasks/types implementingnthis interface automatically get registered - its the simplernsolution for tasks developers ( I think ).nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@273107 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

A small refactoring, getting to a more real interface for the dynamic properties.This is not final, of course.nnPropertyHelper will implement all property manipulation. Eventually innant1.6 the static methods in various places should just wrap andncall this. In 1.6 the property storage can also be migrated to thisnclass.nnIt should be possible by a task or embedding application to replacenthe whole mechanism - no need for discovery on this one, it can bendone by a task.nnThe PropertyInterceptor will be used to plug different sourcesnfor the property. Im thinking to just have tasks/types implementingnthis interface automatically get registered - its the simplernsolution for tasks developers ( I think ).nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@273107 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Changes to DefaultConfigurer:* Uses the DataType role when creating instances for interface properties,n  rather than using the interface itself as the role.nn* Added ObjectConfigurer.getTypedProperty().  This replaces the implicitn  behaviour in DefaultObjectConfigurer.getProperty() where the typedn  property was returned for an unknown property name.nn* Typed properties are set using attributes and references, with then  propertys interface role shorthand name.  Previously, the DefaultConfigurern  would attempt to set the typed property for any unknown attribute orn  reference name.nn* Can have a set() method for a typed property, rather than an add() method.n  Same semantics as setX() and addX() methods.nn* Added a several more test cases.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271227 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Project Model:* Removed if and unless conditions from targets.nn* Moved parsing of project->target dependencies out of DefaultWorkspace,n  into DefaultProjectBuilder.nn* DefaultWorkspace now detects cycles in the target dependency graph.nn* DefaultWorkspace now executes the implicit target for referenced projects.nn* Changes to DefaultProjectBuilder error reporting.nn* Added a few more test cases for DefaultProjectBuilder.nnUnit Tests:nn* Moved AbstractComponentTest.getLogger() up to AbstractMyrmidonTest.nn* Removed AbstractComponentTest.setup().  Components are now created on demand.nn* Use BasicLogger in unit tests.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271835 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

This is a major change. :-)It introduces the concept of a TaskContainer to allow a task to containnother tasks. This allows Task compositionnIt introduces a <parallel> task for multithreading support. There isnalso a <sequential> task.nIt reworks System.out management to handle all task generated outputnand route it through the Ant event system. This handles multithreadednoutput.nnThis is a major rework to the patch originally submitted by Thomas. Inhave taken a different route for the output management, in particular.nnBased on patch by Thomas Christen <chr@active.ch>nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@269371 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Allow typelibs to define custom roles:* Add TypeDeployer interface, which allows control over the deployment ofn  types from a typelib.nn* Add RoleManager.addNameRoleMapping().nn* TypeManager methods now take a role Class object, rather than role name.nn* Replace implicit role and type deployment in DefaultRoleManager.initialize()n  and DefaultDeployer.initialize() with explicit createDeployer( ClassLoader )n  method.nn* DefaultDeployer now keeps track of the ClassLoader created for each typelib.nn* Moved all ClassLoader creation to DefaultDeployer, for the time being.nn* ConverterDef and AbstractTypeDef now use Deployer, rather thann  deploying manually.nn* Fixed DefaultMasterConverter for the case where destination is an interface,n  and there is no appropriate converter registered.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271030 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Replaced usage of Avalon Context with Myrmidon specific Context:* Moved read-only property and resolve methods from TaskContext to new Contextn  interface.  TaskContext now extends the new Context interface.nn* Changed the Configurer methods to use the new Context.  Both implementationsn  use the supplied Context to do property resolution.nn* Renamed TaskContext.getPropertys() -> getProperties().nn* Moved PropertyUtil from configurer to workspace package, as that is nown  the only place it is used.nn* Changed PropertyUtil to work with the new Context.nnRoleManager:nn* A default implementation for a role can now be specified.  Currentlyn  can only do this programatically.nnDefaultMasterConverter:nn* Removed MasterConverter interface.  It is now identified by the Convertern  role.nn* Now caches the converter instances.nn* Changed the converter search algorithm to traverse the *source* classn  hierarchy, including all interfaces.  Chooses the most specialisedn  conversion, and fails if there is more than one such choice.nnDefaultConfigurer:nn* Attempts to convert references, if the type does not match the expected type.nn* Changed handling of nested elements, for named adders/setters:n  * If the method type can be mapped to a role, and that role has a defaultnimplementation, then use that default implementation.n  * Otherwise, if the method type is an interface, fail.n  * Otherwise, create an instance using no-args constructor.nn* Changed handling of nested elements, for typed adders/setters:n  * If the method type can be mapped to a role, and the element name isna type of that role, then use that role to create the instance.n  * Otherwise, use the type factory for the generic data-type role.n  * Attempt to convert the instance if it is not of the expected type.nn* Added a bunch of test cases for new functionality.nn* Renamed all the ConfigTest classes to have descriptive names.nnMisc:nn* Renamed package framework.factorys -> framework.factories.nn* Made tests work when fork = false.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271539 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

This is a major change. :-)It introduces the concept of a TaskContainer to allow a task to containnother tasks. This allows Task compositionnIt introduces a <parallel> task for multithreading support. There isnalso a <sequential> task.nIt reworks System.out management to handle all task generated outputnand route it through the Ant event system. This handles multithreadednoutput.nnThis is a major rework to the patch originally submitted by Thomas. Inhave taken a different route for the output management, in particular.nnBased on patch by Thomas Christen <chr@active.ch>nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@269371 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Replaced usage of Avalon Context with Myrmidon specific Context:* Moved read-only property and resolve methods from TaskContext to new Contextn  interface.  TaskContext now extends the new Context interface.nn* Changed the Configurer methods to use the new Context.  Both implementationsn  use the supplied Context to do property resolution.nn* Renamed TaskContext.getPropertys() -> getProperties().nn* Moved PropertyUtil from configurer to workspace package, as that is nown  the only place it is used.nn* Changed PropertyUtil to work with the new Context.nnRoleManager:nn* A default implementation for a role can now be specified.  Currentlyn  can only do this programatically.nnDefaultMasterConverter:nn* Removed MasterConverter interface.  It is now identified by the Convertern  role.nn* Now caches the converter instances.nn* Changed the converter search algorithm to traverse the *source* classn  hierarchy, including all interfaces.  Chooses the most specialisedn  conversion, and fails if there is more than one such choice.nnDefaultConfigurer:nn* Attempts to convert references, if the type does not match the expected type.nn* Changed handling of nested elements, for named adders/setters:n  * If the method type can be mapped to a role, and that role has a defaultnimplementation, then use that default implementation.n  * Otherwise, if the method type is an interface, fail.n  * Otherwise, create an instance using no-args constructor.nn* Changed handling of nested elements, for typed adders/setters:n  * If the method type can be mapped to a role, and the element name isna type of that role, then use that role to create the instance.n  * Otherwise, use the type factory for the generic data-type role.n  * Attempt to convert the instance if it is not of the expected type.nn* Added a bunch of test cases for new functionality.nn* Renamed all the ConfigTest classes to have descriptive names.nnMisc:nn* Renamed package framework.factorys -> framework.factories.nn* Made tests work when fork = false.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271539 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

VFS Tidy-ups:* Added FileObject.copy().nn* Renamed <v-copy> task attributes file -> srcfile, tofile -> destfile, todir -> destdir.nn* Moved provider instantiation out of DefaultFileSystemManager, and inton  myrmidon-aware VfsManager.  Providers are instantiated using the TypeManager.n  The list of providers isnt configurable yet.nn* Some support for %nn encoded URI (not quite complete).nn* Zip file system now handles zip files from any file system, not just localn  files.  Still read-only at this stage.  Uses a truely dodgy and very temporaryn  replication mechanism.nn* Zip file system now handles relative paths in URI (e.g. zip:relpath.zip), that aren  resolved against the base dir.nn* Fixed bug in resolving names against the root file of a file system.nn* Changed behaviour of FileName.resolveName( .. ) for the root file ofn  a file system.nn* Added more test cases.nn* A bucketload of other minor changes.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271803 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

VFS Tidy-ups:* Added FileObject.copy().nn* Renamed <v-copy> task attributes file -> srcfile, tofile -> destfile, todir -> destdir.nn* Moved provider instantiation out of DefaultFileSystemManager, and inton  myrmidon-aware VfsManager.  Providers are instantiated using the TypeManager.n  The list of providers isnt configurable yet.nn* Some support for %nn encoded URI (not quite complete).nn* Zip file system now handles zip files from any file system, not just localn  files.  Still read-only at this stage.  Uses a truely dodgy and very temporaryn  replication mechanism.nn* Zip file system now handles relative paths in URI (e.g. zip:relpath.zip), that aren  resolved against the base dir.nn* Fixed bug in resolving names against the root file of a file system.nn* Changed behaviour of FileName.resolveName( .. ) for the root file ofn  a file system.nn* Added more test cases.nn* A bucketload of other minor changes.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271803 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Big VAJ changes, in particular if they have ever worked for anybody, they probably wont do so any longer.Make the servlets work by using IBMs servlet classesnPR: 10016nnURL-encoding in <vaj*port> didnt work properly.nnThe VAJ tasks now support a haltonfailure attribute to conditionallynkeep building even if they fail.nnIt is now possible to use the latest (versioned or unversioned)nedition in <vajload> by using special wildcard characters.nPR: 2236.nnSubmitted by:tMartin Landers <landers at in dot tum dot de>nFrancois Rey <francois dot rey at capco dot com>nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@274553 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Some cleanup in Javac. Removed duplicate code and used the nested fileset element of Path to fake extdirs for Jikes.This should change:nn(1) It will scan for all files not only .JAR files in the extdirsnspecified. Javac ignores the extension as well.nn(2) If no extdirs have been specified, the system propertynjava.ext.dirs is consulted.nn(3) JikesOutputParser has been removed, instead the return code ofnjikes determines compilation failures. * Migrated all tests into packages other than the one they are testing. The reason for this is that all the tests are BlackBox, using public APIs and there is no reason to have the testcases in the same package as the actual code. Thus all test code is in a sub-package from the code it actually tests.ie Test code for package foo is located in package foo.testnn* Migrated all the test data into the same hierarchy so that there is only one place where you have to look for test data.nnThis required that resource retrieval be hackled a little because no longer in same package as tested code/nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271870 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

* Migrated all tests into packages other than the one they are testing. The reason for this is that all the tests are BlackBox, using public APIs and there is no reason to have the testcases in the same package as the actual code. Thus all test code is in a sub-package from the code it actually tests.ie Test code for package foo is located in package foo.testnn* Migrated all the test data into the same hierarchy so that there is only one place where you have to look for test data.nnThis required that resource retrieval be hackled a little because no longer in same package as tested code/nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/core/trunk@271870 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

* Merged HTTPSamplerFull functionality into HTTPSampler and eliminated the HTTMSamplerFull class -- they were too tightly coupled. * Changed redirect follow mechanism from recursion to iteration, which allows for nicer sample/subsample setup. * Simplified error handling code - now more readable and hopefully safer. * Using new specialised HTTPSampleResult instead of generic SampleResult. * Removed some methods that were too tightly coupled with their callers (using of member variables to return results, etc.) * Added support to recursively download resources in frames and iframes.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/jmeter/trunk@323752 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Made endpoint resolution more deterministic.  Endpoint resolution now maps the uri prefix to the registered component name.  If the component does not exist, the ComponentResolver is used to auto create it and it assigned to the component name.  This avoid the problem of where multiple components think they map to the same prefix.  - Components now do not need to know what component prefix they have been assigned.  - So that eliminated the need of getUriPrefixesgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/activemq/camel/trunk@525634 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Made endpoint resolution more deterministic.  Endpoint resolution now maps the uri prefix to the registered component name.  If the component does not exist, the ComponentResolver is used to auto create it and it assigned to the component name.  This avoid the problem of where multiple components think they map to the same prefix.  - Components now do not need to know what component prefix they have been assigned.  - So that eliminated the need of getUriPrefixesgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/activemq/camel/trunk@525634 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

@Mock and @Uri are now qualifiers. Added an example of Endpoint injection via @Named. Also simplified the use of @Inject with camel injection; it now requires a qualifier if using @Inject to inject Endpoint/ProducerTemplate of either @Mock, @Uri, @Named - otherwise dont use @Inject and just use the vanilla Camel injection annotations (@Produce or @EndpointInject). The use of qualifiers avoids all kinds of CDI issues when trying to mix and match @Inject @EndpointInject and @Inject @Named in the same application; for Endpoint/ProducerTemplate injection there must be a unique qualifier used now. Note @Consume doesnt do injection per se so @Inject is never used directly with it. Finally @Mock() now takes an optional URI for the MockEndpointgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/camel/trunk@1380275 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

CMComponent must not rely on dependency injection as it should work out of the box.README.md is updated in order to reflect new component name (ncamel-cm-sms instead of camel-cm).

@Mock and @Uri are now qualifiers. Added an example of Endpoint injection via @Named. Also simplified the use of @Inject with camel injection; it now requires a qualifier if using @Inject to inject Endpoint/ProducerTemplate of either @Mock, @Uri, @Named - otherwise dont use @Inject and just use the vanilla Camel injection annotations (@Produce or @EndpointInject). The use of qualifiers avoids all kinds of CDI issues when trying to mix and match @Inject @EndpointInject and @Inject @Named in the same application; for Endpoint/ProducerTemplate injection there must be a unique qualifier used now. Note @Consume doesnt do injection per se so @Inject is never used directly with it. Finally @Mock() now takes an optional URI for the MockEndpointgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/camel/trunk@1380275 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

@Mock and @Uri are now qualifiers. Added an example of Endpoint injection via @Named. Also simplified the use of @Inject with camel injection; it now requires a qualifier if using @Inject to inject Endpoint/ProducerTemplate of either @Mock, @Uri, @Named - otherwise dont use @Inject and just use the vanilla Camel injection annotations (@Produce or @EndpointInject). The use of qualifiers avoids all kinds of CDI issues when trying to mix and match @Inject @EndpointInject and @Inject @Named in the same application; for Endpoint/ProducerTemplate injection there must be a unique qualifier used now. Note @Consume doesnt do injection per se so @Inject is never used directly with it. Finally @Mock() now takes an optional URI for the MockEndpointgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/camel/trunk@1380275 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

added a test case using the Java DSL to perform a routing test for validationgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/activemq/camel/trunk@563510 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

@Mock and @Uri are now qualifiers. Added an example of Endpoint injection via @Named. Also simplified the use of @Inject with camel injection; it now requires a qualifier if using @Inject to inject Endpoint/ProducerTemplate of either @Mock, @Uri, @Named - otherwise dont use @Inject and just use the vanilla Camel injection annotations (@Produce or @EndpointInject). The use of qualifiers avoids all kinds of CDI issues when trying to mix and match @Inject @EndpointInject and @Inject @Named in the same application; for Endpoint/ProducerTemplate injection there must be a unique qualifier used now. Note @Consume doesnt do injection per se so @Inject is never used directly with it. Finally @Mock() now takes an optional URI for the MockEndpointgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/camel/trunk@1380275 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Go back to change screen if Publish and Submit fails on submitThe Publish and Submit action is not atomic. This means if thensubmit fails the comments and approvals will still be published.nIf the screen stays with the PublishCommentScreen on submit failurenthere is no indication for the user that the comments and approvalsnwere actually published. To make this more obvious we now go back tonthe change screen before displaying the submit error. On the changenscreen the user can then see that the comments and approvals werensuccessfully published.nnBug: issue 963nChange-Id: I9fcfd6b89b53db6f672d79714c6942fa953e5dd9nSigned-off-by: Edwin Kempin <edwin.kempin@sap.com>n

Rewrite the side-by-side and unified diff viewersThe new viewers are more accurate, as they dont suffer from thenrepeated file content when context overlaps bug we saw addednnear the start of 2.0.11 development.nnBug: GERRIT-156, GERRIT-14, GERRIT-9nSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Back in-memory caches with Guava, disk caches with H2Instead of using Ehcache for in-memory caches, use Guava. The Guavancache code has been more completely tested by Google in high loadnproduction environments, and it tends to have fewer bugs. It enablesncaches to be built at any time, rather than only at server startup.nnBy creating a Guava cache as soon as it is declared, rather thannduring the LifecycleListener.start() for the CachePool, we can promisenany downstream consumer of the cache that the cache is ready tonexecute requests the moment it is supplied by Guice. This fixes anstartup ordering problem in the GroupCache and the ProjectCache, wherencode wants to use one of these caches during startup to resolve angroup or project by name.nnTracking the Gauva backend caches with a DynamicMap makes it possiblenfor plugins to define their own in-memory caches using CacheModulesncache() function to declare the cache. It allows the core server tonmake the cache available to administrators over SSH with the gerritnshow-caches and gerrit flush-caches commands.nnPersistent caches store in a private H2 database per cache, with ansimple one-table schema that stores each entry in a table row as anpair of serialized objects (key and value). Database reads are gatednby a BloomFilter, to reduce the number of calls made to H2 duringncache misses. In theory less than 3% of cache misses will reach H2 andnfind nothing. Stores happen on a background thread quickly after thenput is made to the cache, reducing the risk that a diff or web_sessionnrecord is lost during an ungraceful shutdown.nnCache databases are capped around 128M worth of stored data by runningna prune cycle each day at 1 AM local server time. Records are removednfrom the database by ordering on the last access time, where lastnaccessed is the last time the record was moved from disk to memory.nnChange-Id: Ia82d056796b5af9bcb1f219fe06d905c9c0fbc84n

Get commentlinks per-project in UI codeRemove commentlinks from GerritConfig and instead provide them in JSONnform from GET /projects/X/config. On the client side, create newnCommentLinkProcessor instances when loading a change or patch.nFortunately, even though this requires another RPC to get the projectnconfig, in all existing screen instances, there is already an RPC wencan parallelize it with.nnIn the long term we may want to enable server-side HTML rendering, butnthat requires enabling this option on a variety of RPC endpoints, notnall of which are converted to the new REST API. In addition, there isnthe problem of defining a stable HTML fragment style. For example, thencommit message template is currently implemented using annot-quite-trivial template in GWTs UiBinder, so some of thatnformatting and styling would need to be hoisted out into the servernside; doable, but were not there yet.nnChange-Id: Iaecbeff939c8fcbc1c6f500e0b04ce03f35e1fd3n

Simplify reference level access control.The initial implementation of reference level access control onlynsupports a corner case, that of locking down access for a specificnbranch.nnUpon further discussion, weve decided that this is not the morengeneral need. Most Gerrit configurations prefer to have a more opennaccess model, where access rights on a reference specified with anwildcard, such as refs/heads/* arent overridden by a more specificnaccess right. So this change makes the default behavior to evaluatenall rights, including the wild card ones.nnHowever, in order to accomodate the corner case we were supportingnbefore, this change also introduces a new way to specify exclusivenreference level access rights. All access rights that start with then- prefix are considered exclusive, and will prevent all wild cardnrights from being considered.nnChange-Id: I629f5439967b2141e46098614fadb25ff28e5f45n

Move the SSH key cache into EhcacheThis way the cache can be viewed through gerrit show-caches, butncan also be configured through gerrit.config, if the administratornwants to apply different caching rules.nnWe now cache the parsed version of the PublicKey, rather than textnrepresentation. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Remove PatchSetInfo from database and get it always from GitThe PatchSetInfo object contains only information that we canneasily acquire from Git by parsing the corresponding commit object.nHaving it in the database is a silly hold-over from Gerrit 1.x,nwhere we did not have access to Git from within the web interfacenand thus had to keep this in the Google AppEngine datastore.nnThis shrinks the amount of metadata we need to store in the SQLndatabase, and lets us trust Git to keep the data instead.nnBug: GERRIT-5nSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Modernize the display of inline comments on a fileLike the prior commit we now show a summary of the comment messagenwhen the comment is collapsed, but clicking the title will expandnthe whole thing and display the complete text.nnComments may also be modified on the publish comments screen, thusnallowing the user to fix typos quickly and easily before they arensent to the interested parties.  If any comments are modified theynare first flushed to the server, then the comments are published.nIdeally we would do this all in one RPC, but the RPC interface isnnot currently built to support it, so its simpler to program thencode to issue the RPCs from the client.nnThe Reply button now appears on all comments and accurately storesnthe parent message, permitting users to reply to different comments.nEventually we can make use of this to quote the message that younare replying to, and to show a threaded view of the comments ifnthere was more than one nested tree.nnChange-Id: Ieb6df2b31f99c3c6288c4bab1a2e4a36cab546c8nSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Prevent test.git.git turning into test.git in the Changes table.Prevent test.git.git turning into test.git in thenChanges table even though the project name is really test.nnGerrit drops the project names trailing .git suffix like:nn p  -> pn p.git  -> pn p/.git -> p.nnthen Gerrit try to search p in cache, if Gerrit cannot find p inncache, Gerrit will check disk repositories with name p, p/.git andnp.git in order.nnSo once users provide test.git.git, Gerrit firstly convert it intontest.git, then search test.git in cache, then search test.git,ntest.git/.git, test.git.git in order in the disk repositories.nSo if test.git exists on disk, Gerrit will return it back and stopnsearching test.git/.git or test.git.git.nnBut in fact Gerrit should search test.git/.git or test.git.git onnthe disk repositories, the logic is:nn ---------------------------------------------------------------n  users provide  | search in cache|  search in disk repositoriesn ----------------+----------------+-----------------------------n p |   p  |  p or  p/.git or p.gitn p/.git|   p  |  p or  p/.git or p.gitn p.git |   p  |  p or  p/.git or p.gitn ----------------+----------------+-----------------------------n  p.git/.git | p.git|  p.git/.git or p.git.gitn  p.git.git  | p.git|  p.git/.git or p.git.gitn ----------------+----------------+-----------------------------nnThis patch fix this bug based on this logic, thus in the case ofnissue 1699 Gerrit will not think of test.git on disk as the providedntest.git.git, so reject the push command and will not create dirtyndata any more.nnBug: issue 1699nChange-Id: I1a884b1e9c95fb940af5d9e8d3d5a074e6388da5

Fix dummy approvals for users that can vote on a labelRemove labels from results in LabelNormalizer if the user has nonvoting permissions whatsoever. Ensure that dummy labels are only addednin ChangeJson.setAllApprovals() for those labels with permissions.nnChange-Id: If143c257fa8fb41dc4b0ca7c997921a73471f6dbn

Drop 2 suffix from CS2, SBS2Now that CS1 and SBS1 have been deleted, the suffixes of 2 onna lot of classes is unncessary and confusing. Drop the suffix.nnChange-Id: Icb8c4797f59f259601f4e436bd2f04a13a904bbcn

Recover from merges that failed after updateRepoSince were now batching more change operations together into a singlentransaction, the chance of a failure causing the changes state andncurrent patch set to not be updated is higher. Prior to usingntransactions, this happened relatively early in the process.nnTry harder to recover from this state: before attempting to merge anchange, see whether some patch set ref of that change has already beennmerged, and if so, just fix up the state and patch set record.nnThis ends up being pretty complicated, and requires doing a bunch ofnisMergedInto checks prior to merging. Hopefully in practice there arennot so many patch sets and/or they are close enough to head to notnmake this too expensive.nnTesting is a little tricky too. Teach Submit to accept a specialnSubmitInput that tells SubmitStrategyListener to abort at a certainnphase, simulating some real-world failures.nnChange-Id: I6922b5970c10fd9e074c1979d9eddb9103ac5d4fn

Move replication logic to replication pluginThis splits all of the replication code out of the core servernand moves it into a standard plugin. A new listener API is usedninside of the core server to notify interested plugins of any Gitnreference changes, which the replication code can hook into tonschedule its events.nnChange-Id: I77ee4440a009c2ce1c62fb6a445c7e3c912245f9n

Insert new changes and patch sets during receive-packChanges for a branch can be pushed to refs/for/$branchname, insertingnany new commits as Change entities with a destination branch given innthe ref line.nnCommits replacing patch sets can be pushed to refs/changes/$changeid/new.nnSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Rewrite UI plugin action description APIUsing methods on an interface that plugins/extensions implementnmakes for a very brittle API. We cannot safely add a new methodnwithout breaking all existing code or introducing another interfacenfor plugins to implement.nnChange the UI action description to be a single method interfacenthat returns an instance of a concrete description object. Pluginsncan populate the fields they know about and need for their use case,nand the server will do its best to honor what the plugin has given.nNew methods can be added to the description without affecting thenAPI versioning, enabling Gerrit to add more features in the future.nnThe confirmation message feature has been removed. In the nearnfuture plugins will have the ability to register JavaScript codento be executed client-side when the button is activated and beforenthe RPC is started. This will allow plugins to perform more customnlogic, such as obtaining additional input.nnLooking even further ahead plugins may register their own JS handlernto render a button, allowing the plugin to use a more complex widget.nThe UiAction.Description type may need to be extended to allownserver side view code to pass custom data to the UI rendering logic.nnChange-Id: If5e0e6b42d6d1e8a111a2d304ce54b9d8834688an

Add a schema version table to facilitate live upgradesThe current version of the database schema is stored into thenschema_version.version_nbr field.  Future versions of Gerrit2ncan update this to a different value and detect at startup ifnan upgrade is required.  Upgrades would involve adding columnsnto tables, or possibly manipulating data to conform to a newnconvention.  The actual code required to perform an upgradenisnt here yet, but we abort if the schema version isntnrecognized by the server.  This prevents an older Gerrit2 fromnusing a newer schema (once a newer schema is developed).nnSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Add keyboard shortcuts and VIM bindingsAdded global keyboard shortcuts.nnAdded shortcuts for:n- Opening / closing comment boxes.n- Saving drafts.n- Going up to change.nnIncluded CodeMirrors VIM bindings for navigation. Removed the onesnthat trigger insert mode. We probably need a way to include only ansubset of VIM bindings.nnFixed CodeMirror.on(). Added EventHandler for handling more types ofnevents.nnRemoved hiddenSkipMap hack and imported CodeMirrors official fix.nnChange-Id: I75923e20e27434ca95882e2d70d10346bdf2323cn

Email notifications of new changes to interested partiesThis way people get up-front indicators that changes are readynfor review, and its in their inbox, where they can keep tracknof things they need to do in the near future.nnSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Use custom error messages for Git-over-HTTPEnsure clients see messages related to contributor agreement notnbeing activated even if they push over HTTP. These used to be putninto the server error log, but the new GitSmartHttpTools class innJGit allows formatting it directly to the client.nnRefactor other things like the server-level receive and uploadncontrols to also report a custom error message that matches withnthe SSH version of the same code.nnChange-Id: Idd35853198fcb3103ebb099bab185c0620573e0fn

Remove ApprovalCategory and ApprovalCategoryValueThese can be completely specified in the project config hierarchy andnthe database tables are no longer required. Also remove the size limitnon patch_set_approvals.category_id, so new PatchSetApprovals can refernto label names rather than IDs.nnMigrate existing labels into project.config in All-Projects. Whennmigrating, also convert existing PatchSetApprovals to refer to labelnnames rather than IDs.nnLabel IDs are still written to PatchSetApprovals and still supportednin project.config. As of this change, update all code to matchnPatchSetApprovals categoryId on either label ID or name.  This allowsnfor the possibility of database migration without downtime (e.g. forngerrit-review.googlesource.com). The default schema migration code,nhowever, does not include label IDs in project.config, since thisnschema migration is only intended to run offline.nnChange-Id: I5df6f0c5665d0ae4ee6b5e2944f5954fa2f96b5cn

Add a Gerrit-specific public key checker implementationChecks that a public key includes a self-signed certification matchingnat least one external ID key or email address in the database. In thencommon case, a user should have a user ID on the key matching at leastnone email address they use with Gerrit, so most users will not have tonadd additional user IDs. In case they do, include a full list of validnuser IDs.nnChange-Id: Ic829b47e755b71fe5e80499b7f72cd8902b574e8n

Upgrade OpenID provider dyuproject to 1.1.1This version contains built-in support for Google Account discovery,nso we dont need to hack it ourselves anymore.nnUnfortunately the authentication approach used by RelyingParty assumesnyou want to do an HTTP redirect to start the authentication.  InsteadnGerrit2 wants to send JSON to the client with the redirect URL.  Wenmust therefore code a little bit more on our side to ensure the usernmanager has saved its cookie.nnThe library now also includes a utility map to create a URL encodednstring; we use this rather than StringBuilder append calls to buildnup any URL which contains query parameters.nnIm specifically not using the SReg support in the library as it doesna request for additional properties we arent too interested in, likenthe users gender.  Instead we just keep our own implementation of thenSReg extension.nnSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Right now there is nonpossibility to set or remove the parenthood from the UI.nnBug: issue 273nChange-Id: Iac514de89e24b470339ea53065f8b470de68ab75nUploaded-by: Ulrik Sju00c3u00b6lin <ulrik.sjolin@sonyericsson.com>nSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Factor out code for updating notes branches to NotesBranchUtil.The CreateCodeReviewNotes and BanCommit classes both need the samenfunctionality of updating a notes branch and automatic merge of notentrees. The code was repeated in both classes with slight variations.nThe same functionality will probably be needed as soon as we introducenyet another special purpose notes branch.nnChange-Id: If2fc17cd795585a9f90bb0bf82695db9bd04392cnSigned-off-by: Sasa Zivkov <sasa.zivkov@sap.com>n

Markdown formatting improvementsExtract the first H1 level string from the documentation and make thatnthe HTML page title. Embed a small block of CSS that makes the stylenof the page look more like the rest of the Gerrit documentation pages.nWrap the entire pegdown output in a proper HTML tag.nnThe pegdown.css is cached when read from a JAR, but loads on demandnwhen read from a file:// URL. This enables a fast edit-view cycle ofnthe style sheet when running the server from within Eclipse or anothernIDE that loads the resources from the source tree.nnIf the Documentation/ URL ends with / redirect to look for index.htmlninstead. This provides some simple support for directory indexes bynallowing directory references to jump to the index.html document,nwhich might be index.md in the JAR.nnIf the plugin doesnt answer to / on its own, redirect web requestsnfor /plugins/NAME to /plugins/NAME/Documentation/index.html allowingnthe user to at least see the documentation.nnOnly attempt to convert resources that end with .md from Markdown tonHTML, rather than everything.nnDocumentation and static resources are only available by GET and HEADnHTTP methods. POST, PUT, DELETE, etc. will fail with an error.nnIf there is no index.html or index.md in Documentation/, render one onnthe fly by creating a listing of documentation pages, extracting theirntitles and rendering it using the MarkdownFormatter.  This keeps thenstyle consistent with the rest of the documentation in a plugin.nnWhen rendering Documentation files from Markdown to HTML, replace thenmacro @PLUGIN@ with the current name of the plugin. This allowsnauthors to write documentation with reasonably accurate examples thatnadjusts automatically based on the installation.nnAlso support @URL@, @SSH_HOST@, and @SSH_PORT@ replacements innMarkdown documentation for common ways to reference this server.nnMacros that start with  such as @KEEP@ will render as @KEEP@neven if there is an expansion for KEEP in the future.nnFormatted documentation and other static resources for plugins arencached in memory, to save response time when sending frequentlynrequested items to clients.nnChange-Id: I988038021d4a047bd008561aeedc3ccfd5a1b294n

Simplify CodeMirror wrapper JSNILineCharacter (aka {from, to} objects) is the same as Pos innCodeMirror.  The CodeMirror documentation suggests using a Posnobject in a number of function calls, but it can be unclear thisnis the LineCharacter wrapper in GerritnnRename LineCharacter to Pos, and change its factory methods tonconstruct using CodeMirror.Pos(line, ch) so instances are of thentype CodeMirror expects internally.nnSimplify accessor methods by dropping the get/set Java idiom andnuse the field name as the method name. Argument overloading makesnit possible to identify between a get and a set variant. This makesnthese lightweight JSNI wrappers feel more like an @AutoValue objectnor raw JavaScript code that they are interacting with.nnChange-Id: If73536652cc5559fcef5b2519cb686460a126ff5n

Move batch user priority to a capabilityInstead of using a magical group, use a special capability tondenote users that should get the batch priority behavior.nnChange-Id: I3e1f8f3ee39f5dcb2cdad2f9c71c46db25fc30b6n

BatchUpdate: Dont update change if there was nothing to doCommitting the transaction and indexing the change can be expensive,nso allow ops to skip that if they did nothing. Similar to hownupdateRepo can be a no-op if no commands were added, except we dontncommunicate this through the context and instead through a returnnvalue. This is distinct from the insert/save/deleteChange methods onnChangeContext, which refer specifically to the Change entity; a methodncould update a non-Change entity and return true without callingnsaveChange.nnChange-Id: Id51eec8f9dfa35c80f062a365195f25777f60006n
Implementing replace.Previously replace wasnt implemented. Also refactored the code to reducenduplication.nnChange-Id: Iaf33293116a30b30d4d9ee1b22333eaee4da8332n

Tweak PatchSetInserter to look more like ChangeInserterDont pass in the repo and RevWalk, since those should come from thenRepoContext. Change callers to use the same Repository/RevWalk/nObjectInserter instances and call setRepository on the enclosingnBatchUpdate.nnDont lazily compute patch set ID; have callers compute it themselvesnand pass it in at construction time, since we no longer have anRepository instance in the PatchSetInserter.nnChange-Id: I845b887ae7ffc2c1a14bad13c62c41ff1ff6fc34n

SubmoduleOp: Submit different Submodules in one commitBefore this commit there was just one `SubmoduleOp.update()`nmethod to do it all. Now this is split up into two parts:n* The submodule subscription update, which inspects eachn  branch for possible changes in submodule subscriptionsn  during each change of the branch tip.n* The update of superprojects, which will be performedn  once per merge or push operation.nnThe the internal data structures which are passed around,nare easier to follow now by passing a collection ofnSubmoduleSubscriptions into the updateGitlinks method.nnChange-Id: I021272b75939707ec22764568d27e3f6413899adn
Implementing replace.Previously replace wasnt implemented. Also refactored the code to reducenduplication.nnChange-Id: Iaf33293116a30b30d4d9ee1b22333eaee4da8332n

Use dedicated endpoint for commit message retrieval for revisionsInstead of using GET /changes/<number>/edit:message for both edits andnnormal revisions, differentiate on the client side and use dedicatednendpoints.nnChange-Id: I7e9786c0b828cca9b0aa76bab43f10d223334d86n

SideBySide2: Reduce scrolling jankUpdate the other CodeMirror3 top position immediately, rather thannwaiting with a delay. This improves UI feel by reducing the visiblenjank during scrolling.nnIn the common case of scrolling a large number of lines that arenunmodified and visible, the line heights are identical and adjustingnthe Y position immediately comes up with correct results. This givesnscrolling the UI a smoother feeling, like the old SideBySide view.nnWhile scrolling run a timer every 20 milliseconds to update the othernCodeMirror3 with more accurate position information. This is necessarynto fix up incorrect widget height estimates. The height of offscreennline widgets used for padding and comment boxes arent computed by CM3nuntil they first become visible in the document, which sometimes causesnthe view to be unaligned.nnThe timer uses a second 20 millisecond delay (for a total of 40 ms) tondetect when scrolling ends. The full 40ms delay must elapse beforenthe user can switch to the other CM3 instance and begin scrollingnagain. Scrolling on the same document is always available and resetsnthe timer for another 40ms delay.nnChange-Id: I40d6271cd5103249f43e9ecaf6eb1e75181a7dbbn

Parse project names through custom args4j OptionHandlerInstead of taking the project name as a string, parse it throughnthe ProjectControl.Factory and acquire the ProjectControl only ifnthe current user is able to see the specified project.nnChange-Id: I20d303a309fcc46a651d470d91c56ca6de5ca4c5nSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Duplicate vim keymap before deleting keysInstead of deleting command keys from the main vim map, clone the mapnto vim_ro and delete from the copy.  This leaves the main vim mapnpristine and can therefore be used in editable copies of CodeMirror,nsuch as for the commit message or editing a file in the browser.nnChange-Id: I446b7acf406cfe859158b3f00cfe47fec80eff83n

Serve GWT UI from ResourceServletWe already have a somewhat-featureful static content servlet fornserving data from /static; use it for the GWT UI as well. Javas zipnfilesystem support makes the war case easy; we dont have to do thenextract-to-a-directory hack that makes it work with Jetty. Thendeveloper case is also pretty easy, though we have to move thenfilter to recompile the GWT UI into the httpd package.nnOne other wrinkle is that the GWT build process puts bogus timestampsnon the GWT compiler output, so we need to pretend the timestamps onnall the files are the startup time of the server. This means clientsnwill have to re-download large identical JS assets after a servernrestart even if the assets didnt change. Gerrit has mostly prettyngood uptime so this is not a huge deal.nnChange-Id: I0a7ade3cadf3a4a4e1726b56b87b0cbe4c6e0c93n

SideBySide2: Fix Ctrl-C to copy text in CM4The vim mode changed the way the keymap is implemented. In CM4 vimnmode now uses the call method and does not defined specific keysnwithin the map. Copying the map object and deleting entries was anno-op and that meant vim mode still handled keys like Ctrl-C thatnGerrit wanted to propagate up into the browser.nnBuild our own KeyMap object that sets up non-bindings for thenspecific keys that should go up the DOM tree, and then fallbacknto the KeyMap object provided by vim mode.nnChange-Id: I3aa14a170cedf6100a8de0df88a584810980530bn

WalkSorter: Manual, partial topo sortIn I77a5b606 we attempted to limit the topo sort using JGits mergenbase calculation, but this requires one RevFlag per start commit,nwhich fails if there are more than 26 related changes in a list--nuncommon, but supported.nnThat approach also had some other drawbacks, so just throw it out.nInstead, do a partial topo sort manually, which ensures that no parentnis emitted before a direct child also in the list.nnChange-Id: I7e87b3fc6885e319e5ca9b9bb974f65e016c647dn

SideBySide2: Fix patchset id for comments and drafts.Previously, only published comments under revision werendisplayed, and all drafts were published under revision.nFixed to use base when applicable.nnChange-Id: I6b915a7c96570bd1146c4d3c0212ceefdf919565n

Support per-project access controls by groupProjects (and their changes) may now be restricted to being visiblenonly to certain groups, providing for shared but private access whennnecessary.  These restrictions are enforced on the web and on the SSHndaemon on a per-project basis.nnBy default read access is granted to Anonymous Users, making the sitenvisible to all, but this can be overridden within a specific project,nor globally by removing the Anonymous Users READ grant from the defaultnproject that everyone inherits from.nnSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

SideBySide2: Reduce scrolling jankUpdate the other CodeMirror3 top position immediately, rather thannwaiting with a delay. This improves UI feel by reducing the visiblenjank during scrolling.nnIn the common case of scrolling a large number of lines that arenunmodified and visible, the line heights are identical and adjustingnthe Y position immediately comes up with correct results. This givesnscrolling the UI a smoother feeling, like the old SideBySide view.nnWhile scrolling run a timer every 20 milliseconds to update the othernCodeMirror3 with more accurate position information. This is necessarynto fix up incorrect widget height estimates. The height of offscreennline widgets used for padding and comment boxes arent computed by CM3nuntil they first become visible in the document, which sometimes causesnthe view to be unaligned.nnThe timer uses a second 20 millisecond delay (for a total of 40 ms) tondetect when scrolling ends. The full 40ms delay must elapse beforenthe user can switch to the other CM3 instance and begin scrollingnagain. Scrolling on the same document is always available and resetsnthe timer for another 40ms delay.nnChange-Id: I40d6271cd5103249f43e9ecaf6eb1e75181a7dbbn
Dont repeat missing dependency messages multiple timesOnce is enough.nnSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

SubmoduleOp: Submit different Submodules in one commitBefore this commit there was just one `SubmoduleOp.update()`nmethod to do it all. Now this is split up into two parts:n* The submodule subscription update, which inspects eachn  branch for possible changes in submodule subscriptionsn  during each change of the branch tip.n* The update of superprojects, which will be performedn  once per merge or push operation.nnThe the internal data structures which are passed around,nare easier to follow now by passing a collection ofnSubmoduleSubscriptions into the updateGitlinks method.nnChange-Id: I021272b75939707ec22764568d27e3f6413899adn

SideBySide2: Add file comment functionalityAdded functionality to display, add and edit file comments. Chose tonadd a separate table on top of the two CMs, because messingnaround with CM linewidgets and adjusting the padding is not fun,nparticularly when it happens on the somewhat quirky first line.nFor simplicity, FileCommentPanel is table-based, and the padding willnlook like whats in the old view.nnAdded PatchSelectBox2. Currently it only holds the icon to add filencomments. PatchSetBox2 and file comments auto-hide the same waynGerrit header does.nnFixed glitch in line padding code. Padding for CommentBox stillnneeds to be calculated by PaddingManager, The previous change was toonsimplistic and introduced misalignment.nnExperiment with new scrolling hack. The previous approach of syncingnscrollTop doesnt work when CM constantly refuses to take the heightsnof line widgets into account. Added an ad-hoc check to see if thenlines are actually aligned and do additional scrolling if necessary.nnRemoved the default 4px vertical padding at the top and the bottom ofnCodeMirror instances.nnChange-Id: I066ed2bde342eabd37759a13ed43ddba0f12d436n
Replace multiple if (x) return; statements with single conditionalChange-Id: I9487687586ca4694fd0bca87a13b813e5d1ff188n
Implementing replace.Previously replace wasnt implemented. Also refactored the code to reducenduplication.nnChange-Id: Iaf33293116a30b30d4d9ee1b22333eaee4da8332n

Merging Changes: Do not enter submitted stateRecently the MergeQueue was removed, such that the submit processnwill directly tell users the result of their submission (merge or reject).nFor that changes were submitted and directly merged after. If problemsn(such as a server going down, power loss etc.) occur between setting thensubmitted state and the actual merge being performed, these changes wouldnbe stuck in the submitted state, which is annoying UI wise, but the userncould just try to resubmit once the problems are solved.nnThis change moves changes directly from NEW to MERGED if possible ornrejects otherwise. We still need to keep lots of code in the Submit classnto record the Submit label. Eventually this can be moved into the MergeOpnas well.nnThe MergeOp doesnt rely on the submitted state as well any more butnjust integrates the given changes. So changes which are submitted, butnnot merged on the same branch are left untouched now. So the tests whichnare testing exactly these corner cases of submitted changes on the samenbranch are adapted.nnCurrently the test `submitMultipleChanges` is rather testing that thenother changes on the same target branch are left alone. Instead wenwant to test if the submit strategy can submit changes both vianfast forward as well as merging if its necessary. After applyingnthis change the name of `submitMultipleChanges` is correct again.nnThere is no access to the submitter when running a submit strategynas it is not in the submitted state any more, so we need another waynof transporting the information of who is trying to integrate the changento the submit strategy, so we do that via another argument innSubmitStrategy$Argument.nnThe CherryPick strategy has a slight change in behavior as well.nThe committer for a cherry-picked change will be the server insteadnof the submitter as this aligns better with the other submit strategies,ncreating new commits on behalf of the user.nnChange-Id: I9a0c111c1cb3544774b2783c4f76318e2634faf2n

Split PatchListLoader, IntraLineLoader to top-level classesThis simple refactoring just shrinks the size of the mainnPatchListCacheImpl class, reducing the amount of effort itntakes to read the cache implementation, or either loader.nnBecause we no longer have code to format a git diff style file headern(we reuse code inside of JGit now), we can drop the BSD copyrightnheader and notices from 3rd parties that contributed that code we hadnborrowed.nnChange-Id: I1d0d3da11985770516e6707e9b2e97c00fb825b1nSigned-off-by: Shawn O. Pearce <sop@google.com>n

Allow JavaScript plugins to manage their own action RPCsThis is the first step in building a public JavaScript API thatncan be utilized by plugins to manage interaction with the web UI.nnThis commit makes the following plugin JavaScript possible:nn  Gerrit.install(function(self) {nfunction onCallMe(c) {n  var f = c.textfield();n  var t = c.checkbox();n  var b = c.button(Phone, {onclick: function(){nc.call(n  {message: f.value, dial: t.checked},n  function(r) {nc.hide();nwindow.alert(Said  + r);nc.refresh();n  });n  }});n  c.popup(c.div(nf, c.br(),nc.label(t, Dial), c.br(),nb));n  f.focus();n}nself.onAction(revision, callme, onCallMe);n  });nnJavaScript plugins are encouraged to protect the global namespacenby running Gerrit.install(f), passing an anonymous function Gerritncan call to initialize the plugin.nnGerrit.install() performs some black magic to identify which pluginnthe JavaScript is running from, exporting as Gerrit.getPluginName().nObtaining the name is faster within the install() invocation as thenstring is cached in a global variable.nnA plugins install function is given a reference to the pluginnJavaScript object. This object has many helper methods to supportncommunication with the server.nnGerrit.onAction() accepts the type of view and the RestView namenas defined in the plugin and a JavaScript function to execute whennthe user has activated the action button.nnAn action callback is given a context object declaring a number ofnuseful properties:nn  change:  The ChangeInfo object.n  revision:The RevisionInfo object.n  action:  The ActionInfo object that invoked this callback.nn  popup(e):Display a popup containing element e.n  hide():  Hide the popup that was created by popup.nn  call(in,cb): Executes the RPC using action.method.n  get(cb): Executes the RPC using GET.n  post(in,cb): Executes the RPC using POST.n  put(in,cb):  Executes the RPC using PUT.n  delete(cb):  Executes the RPC using DELETE.nn  HTML: br, hr, button, checkbox, div, label, span, textfieldn  These make it easier to construct a tiny UI for use in an  popup, such as gathering a small amount if input from then  user to supply to the RPC.nn  go(token):   Navigate the web UI to the application URL.n  refresh():   Redisplay the current web UI view.nnAny result data from the server is parsed as JSON and passed as-isnto the callback function. A JSON string result is given as a string,na JSON object or array is passed as-is.nnA corresponding REST API view on revisions can be declared:nn  class Module extends RestApiModule {n@Overridenprotected void configure() {n  post(RevisionResource.REVISION_KIND, callme).to(CallMe.class);n}n  }nn  class CallMe implementsn  RestModifyView<RevisionResource, CallMe.Input>,n  UiAction<RevisionResource> {nstatic class Input {n  String message;n}nn@Overridenpublic String apply(RevisionResource resource, Input input) {n  return You said:  + input.message;n}nn@Overridenpublic UiAction.Description getDescription(RevisionResource resource) {n  return new UiAction.Description().setLabel(Call Me);n}n  }nnCurrently the JavaScript code must be registered at the server sidento appear in the host page download:nn  class Web extends AbstractModule {n@Overridenprotected void configure() {n  DynamicSet.bind(binder(), WebUiPlugin.class)n.toInstance(new JavaScriptPlugin(maybe.js));n}nnI find this binding method for JavaScript code is awkard and wouldnlike to improve on it in the future.nnFinally both modules must be registered in the plugin manifest:nn  gerrit_plugin(nname = actiondemo,nsrcs = glob([src/main/java/**/*.java]),nresources = glob([src/main/resources/**/*]),nmanifest_entries = [n  Gerrit-Module: com.googlesource.gerrit.plugins.actiondemo.Module,n  Gerrit-HttpModule: com.googlesource.gerrit.plugins.actiondemo.Web,n],n  )nnChange-Id: I2d572279ac978e644772b1cedbecc080746a2306n

Unify SideBySide2 header widgetsCombine the two header widgets into a single panel and compactnthe entire display to take up less overall screen space. Thenheader is now only a single line of text.nnThe format looks like:nn  [x] path/of/FILE   < ^ >nnThe reviewed checkbox is on the left next to the file name.nnThe path uses plain text for the directory part and BOLD for thenfile name itself. This makes it easier to spot the specific filenname being reviewed.nnThe navigation arrows are now clustered on the right using ansmall icon for each. This saves a lot of screen space.nnChange-Id: Ibd6b7e1022bfe3d6e97638df1fc94f492dae9af1n

- Added the isClosed(), activate(), isActive() methods to the Appender interface.Ther idea is to avoid using appenders which are not in working order. Moreover, in future version, we would like to introducenthe capability for appenders suffering from temporary error conditions to have a recovery lifecycle.nn- Added getNonFloodingLogger method to ComponentBase. This method returns a NOPLogger if called too frequently.nn- Other minor changes.nnngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@311286 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Fix https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=49884This required a major re-factoring of the async implementation. In summary:n- Moved state management to the Coyote Processorn- Added a SocketWrapper to the APR socketn- Added syncs to ensure only one async state change at a timen- Added syncs to ensure only one thread changing a sockets state at a timennA number of new bugs were also uncovered and fixed by this re-factoring:n- delay processing complete() and dispatch() until request where startAsync() is called finished processingn- onAsyncStart listener eventnnCurrently the test case for bug 49884 passes with the security manager enabled using ab -n 5000 -c 150 -k ... (it broke with ab -n 50 -c 10 ... previously) nnThe unit tests pass for all three HTTP connectors.nnThe AJP connectors have only been modified to ensure the code compiles.nnThe following work remains:n- Testing all connectors (HTTP and AJP) with TCK + security manager and fixing whatever is brokenn- Further clean-upn- There is further scope for reducing code duplication between the connectors / aligning the code so it is easier to maintain.nngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1001698 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

- I had some problems when shutting down pollers which had active connections in them. So Im adding code to wait until the poll call is done before doing the   poller stop.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/tc6.0.x/trunk@410095 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

- Remove unwrap loop (that would have to be replicated across all unwrap codes in NIO and NIO2; I did still get some amount of timeouts in my testing - since the fix only covered non blocking unwrap, not the blocking unwrap). - Fix the engine unwrap code to take into account that it is not possible to know if theres some plaintext to read unless trying it (this is what the priming read is about, but it needs to be repeated). - Thanks to Mark for his most excellent debugging. No thanks to OpenSSL for the funny behavior. - Testing is almost fine now with NIOx except I get an overflow with the byte counter, and the unwrap/read code doesnt handle overflows at all. Increasing the socket input buffer avoids this, although it is already at application buffer size, which is supposed to be enough. Will investigate to determine the best solution.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1710608 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Revert original fix for BZ 57142 that attempted to: - determine if the page might use EL - if it did, create the ELContext (that would be required anyway) and set the   necessary imports on the ImportHandler when the page loadsThis alternative implementation:n- Generates a list of package and class imports at compilation timen- Which are then used when the ELContext is creatednnThe main advantage of this approach is that the ELContext is only generated if it is definitely going to be used rather than if it might be used. There are also some minor optimisations regarding the timing of the String processing to differentiate between package and class imports.nngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1644516 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Improve the ChatServlet comet example. 1. Fix possible deadlock in ChatServlet$MessageSender, similar to BZ 48843. 2. Properly wake up ChatServlet$MessageSender when the servlet is destroyed. 3. Filter special characters when printing the message in ChatServlet. 4. Provide an explicit charset everywhere. 5. Fix frames layout. Fix redirections. Use target=<name> attribute in HTML to send request to a particular frame. 6. Fix DTDs. Use frameset DTD for the page containing frames. 7. Add xxx joined the chat message at startup. 8. Rename chat.jsp -> index.jsp, so that the entry point to this example is more visible. 9. Corrected the link that opens a new chat window. It referenced an undefined JavaScript function. Now it is implemented just by using target=_blank. 10. Added submit button to the form pages. 11. Minor message tweaks.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@935105 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Fix https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=49884This required a major re-factoring of the async implementation. In summary:n- Moved state management to the Coyote Processorn- Added a SocketWrapper to the APR socketn- Added syncs to ensure only one async state change at a timen- Added syncs to ensure only one thread changing a sockets state at a timennA number of new bugs were also uncovered and fixed by this re-factoring:n- delay processing complete() and dispatch() until request where startAsync() is called finished processingn- onAsyncStart listener eventnnCurrently the test case for bug 49884 passes with the security manager enabled using ab -n 5000 -c 150 -k ... (it broke with ab -n 50 -c 10 ... previously) nnThe unit tests pass for all three HTTP connectors.nnThe AJP connectors have only been modified to ensure the code compiles.nnThe following work remains:n- Testing all connectors (HTTP and AJP) with TCK + security manager and fixing whatever is brokenn- Further clean-upn- There is further scope for reducing code duplication between the connectors / aligning the code so it is easier to maintain.nngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1001698 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

- I had some problems when shutting down pollers which had active connections in them. I cant   reproduce any problem anymore, unfortunately, but I think it was because there was a poll going   on while the sockets in the poller were being destroyed, which could then lead to these sockets   being destroyed again. So Im adding code to wait until the poll call is done before doing the   poller stop.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/tc6.0.x/trunk@410095 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Moved the connection pool to a top level class and started to add more code. Still missing is evicting kept-alive connections and queueing to limit the number of active requests per host ( and probably more ). Started to make spdy more like a part of a http request - i.e. upgrade if supported by both ends, etc.  Now load tests seem to work - no more OOM. Due to compression spdy its using more memory per connection, current tests dont enable compression ( its accepted for incoming connections ).git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@898619 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

First part of the Servlet3 web-fragment support. This patch inserts a stage into the web.xml processing. web.xml files are now parsed and loaded into an instance of WebXml and then that WebXml instance is used to configure the context. This will allow the subsequent addition of parsing and merging web-fragment.xml files. The hooks are in place to add this functionality but it has not yet been written. With the patch applied, the Servlet 2.5 TCK and JSP 2.1 TCK pass with the exception of the Servlet version number checks.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@816951 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

First part of the Servlet3 web-fragment support. This patch inserts a stage into the web.xml processing. web.xml files are now parsed and loaded into an instance of WebXml and then that WebXml instance is used to configure the context. This will allow the subsequent addition of parsing and merging web-fragment.xml files. The hooks are in place to add this functionality but it has not yet been written. With the patch applied, the Servlet 2.5 TCK and JSP 2.1 TCK pass with the exception of the Servlet version number checks.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@816951 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

SSLEngine is an attribute of the APR lifecycle listener to initialize the native SSL layer once per VM. All HTTP connectors share an attribute called SSLEnabled with true/false values to turn on SSL at the socket level. The scheme and secure attributes simply override the request.getScheme and request.isSecure values.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/tc6.0.x/trunk@465675 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Add a test when sending a DATA frame on a stream that is already closed Refactor the StreamStateMachine to track which frames are permitted in which states Update the parser to check the frame type for non-zero streams Separate incrementWindowSize (triggered by incoming frame) and decrementWindowSize(triggered by write)git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1683698 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Refactor TldLocationsCache to use scan results from the initializer. Refactoring to reduce the impact on the memory footprint of the resource cache within the web application class loader. Main changes: - WebResources caches everything apart from classes - WebResources is responsible for EBCDIC conversion for properties files - The class loader cache now only caches the last modified time of any resource loaded through the class loader and loaded classes.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1731275 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Remove SSLExt and related classes.SSLExt has a lot of native methods that are said to be implemented in Tomcat Native trunk,nbut actually there in no implementation code for them in current native trunk.nnIt looks that some methods have already been moved elsewhere, e.g. into SSLContext class.nnAprSocket, AprSocketContext rely on SSLExt.nI tried to selectively remove code, but calls likenSSLExt.sslSetMode(socket, SSLExt.SSL_MODE_ENABLE_PARTIAL_WRITE |nSSLExt.SSL_MODE_ACCEPT_MOVING_WRITE_BUFFER);ncannot be replaced.nnHostInfo is a simple serializable class that hold information on a host. RFC 7230 states that clients should ignore reason phrases in HTTP/1.1 response messages. Since the reason phrase is optional, Tomcat no longer sends it. As a result the system property org.apache.coyote.USE_CUSTOM_STATUS_MSG_IN_HEADER is no longer used and has been removed.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1702765 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

More fun and games with nested lambda expressions. Each invocation of a nested expression consumes a set of method parameters. Therefore nested lambda expressions that are invoked immediately (because they have no formal parameetrs) need to inform the outer expression of the invocation so the next invocation uses the correct method parameters.git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1504281 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Remove SSLExt and related classes.SSLExt has a lot of native methods that are said to be implemented in Tomcat Native trunk,nbut actually there in no implementation code for them in current native trunk.nnIt looks that some methods have already been moved elsewhere, e.g. into SSLContext class.nnAprSocket, AprSocketContext rely on SSLExt.nI tried to selectively remove code, but calls likenSSLExt.sslSetMode(socket, SSLExt.SSL_MODE_ENABLE_PARTIAL_WRITE |nSSLExt.SSL_MODE_ACCEPT_MOVING_WRITE_BUFFER);ncannot be replaced.nnHostInfo is a simple serializable class that hold information on a host. Also related to unimplemented NPN support.nngit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1712683 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n

Refactoring. Switch from a boolean to an Enum for error state so we can differentiate between an error that requires the connection is closed after the current response is completed and an error that requires that the connection is closed immediately. This commit should be a NO-OP. While the different error states are set, the only the presence of an error (or not) is tested - i.e. no change from the implementation prior to this commit. Try to be consistent when an error occurs. Set the status code first (if required), then set the error state and finally log (if required).git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk@1600109 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68n
